title: Fix bidder-selection bidding error caused by hardcoded bidder names

requirements.text: Fix the backend bidding validation so that placing a bid accepts the two configured bidder names (entered during setup) instead of only accepting the hardcoded names "Bidder 1" and "Bidder 2".

quotes: When I select the bidder after entering correct amount it says only 2 two bidders can bedd

acceptanceCriteria: After starting a new auction with custom bidder names, selecting either of those bidders and placing a valid bid does not throw an error about only two bidders/players being supported.
Backend `bidPlayer` verifies the bidder by checking membership in `auctionState.bidders` (and that there are exactly 2 bidders configured), rather than comparing to literal strings.
If an unknown bidder name is provided, the backend traps with a clear English error message indicating the bidder is not part of the current auction.

requirements.text: Update the user-facing error message shown when a bid fails due to an invalid bidder so it is clear and grammatically correct in English (e.g., indicate that the selected bidder is not part of the auction).

quotes: it says only 2 two bidders can bedd

acceptanceCriteria: When the backend rejects a bid due to an invalid bidder, the UI displays the backend error message in readable English (no duplicated words, no confusing reference to "players").
The error state remains within the existing bidding error UI (no crashes; the auction screen continues to function).

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; add backend/migration.mo only if persisted state changes require it.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Adding support for more than 2 bidders.
Changing budgets, player count, or overall auction flow beyond fixing the bidder-validation bug.
Adding third-party authentication or external databases.
